articleTitle: Mass. lawmakers pass -- and pass on -- flurry of bills in final hours of formal session
articleDescription: The Massachusetts Legislature has ended its 19-month formal session. Lawmakers approved a housing bond bill but left other major proposals in limbo including an economic development bill, a renewable energy bill and a hospital bill. With Thursday's close, the…
articleContent: BOSTON The Massachusetts Legislature ended its 19-month formal session early Thursday morning, approving a housing bond bill, but leaving other major pieces of legislation in limbo including an econo… [+4711 chars]
fqTitle: Will Massachusetts Legislature approve an economic development bill by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the Massachusetts Legislature approves an economic development bill by August 31, 2024. Approval must be confirmed by official legislative records or reputable news sources.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel lay off more than 15% of its workforce by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if Intel lays off more than 15% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The layoffs must be officially confirmed by Intel through a public announcement or reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

articleContent:
ATLANTA (AP) Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month, ahead of his 100th birthday, with a musical gala at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, The Carter Center announced Thursday. 
The Sept… [+1834 chars]

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if a musical gala is held at Atlanta's Fox Theatre by August 31, 2024. The event must be publicly announced and confirmed by reputable news organizations or the official venue's website.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India finalize a $300 million loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if India finalizes a $300 million loan to Vietnam specifically for maritime security by August 31, 2024. The finalization must be officially confirmed by either the Indian or Vietnamese government through a public announcement or official document. If no such confirmation is made by that date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner

fqTitle: Will India and Vietnam announce a plan to double their trade and investment by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if India and Vietnam publicly announce a formal plan to double their trade and investment by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official government source from either India or Vietnam. If no such plan is announced by that date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger
articleDescription: An inmate has been sentenced to more than four years in connection with the 2018 prison slaying of notorious Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger. Paul J. DeCologero was sentenced Thursday. He was accused of being a lookout while another inmate…
articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will Paul J. DeCologero appeal his sentencing by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if Paul J. DeCologero, who was sentenced to more than four years for his role in the 2018 killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger, files an official appeal against his sentencing by August 31, 2024.

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if any new criminal charges are officially filed against Paul J. DeCologero, who was sentenced for his role in the 2018 killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger, by August 31, 2024.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits exceed 249,000 in any week by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits exceeds 249,000 in any week between now and August 31, 2024. The data must be reported by the U.S. Department of Labor or another reputable source.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a rule banning airlines from charging parents to sit with their children be implemented by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is implemented that bans airlines from charging parents to sit with their children 13 years old or younger. The rule must be officially enacted and applicable to U.S. and foreign carriers operating in the United States.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…

The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will the U.S. Department of Transportation finalize a rule regarding seating for children by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation finalizes and enacts a rule that requires airlines to seat children 13 years old or younger with their parents without an additional charge.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any major U.S. airline publicly announces and implements a policy to stop charging parents to sit with their children 13 years old or younger, independent of any regulatory requirement.

articleTitle: Democrats tee up vote on child tax credit in election-year pitch to families
articleDescription: Democratic Senate Leader Chuck Schumer is daring Republicans to vote against a bipartisan tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit for millions of families and restoring some business tax breaks. Senate Republicans appear prepared to do just th…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) Democratic Senate Leader Chuck Schumer is daring Republicans to vote against a bipartisan tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit for millions of families and restorin… [+5263 chars]
fqTitle: Will a bipartisan tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit pass by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if a bipartisan tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit for families passes in the Senate by August 31, 2024. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records.

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if at least one Senate Republican votes in favor of a tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit for families by August 31, 2024. The vote must be confirmed by official Senate records.

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if Chuck Schumer, the Democratic Senate Leader, makes a public statement specifically regarding a vote on a tax cut package aimed at expanding the child tax credit by August 31, 2024. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will the U.S. road safety agency conclude its investigation into the April crash involving a Tesla by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. road safety agency concludes its investigation into the April crash near Seattle involving a Tesla using the company's Full Self-Driving system. A conclusion is defined as the agency releasing a final report or statement regarding the investigation.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system
articleDescription: U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the company’s “Full Self-Driving” system when it hit and killed a motorcyclist. The National Highway Traffic Safety A…
articleContent: DETROIT (AP) U.S. road safety investigators say they will look into an April crash near Seattle after authorities determined that a Tesla was operating on the companys Full Self-Driving system when i… [+1955 chars]
fqTitle: Will the U.S. road safety agency recommend any regulatory changes as a result of the April crash involving a Tesla by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. road safety agency recommends any new regulatory changes as a result of the investigation into the April crash near Seattle involving a Tesla using the company's Full Self-Driving system. Recommendations must be officially documented in a report or public statement.

articleTitle: US road safety agency will look into fatal crash near Seattle involving Tesla using automated system

fqTitle: Will Tesla make any changes to its Full Self-Driving system as a direct result of the April crash investigation by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla announces or implements any changes to its Full Self-Driving system that are directly attributed to the findings of the investigation into the April crash near Seattle. The attribution must be explicitly mentioned in Tesla's official communications.

articleTitle: Black and other minority farmers are getting $2 billion from USDA after years of discrimination
articleDescription: Black and other minority farmers are set to receive more than $2 billion in federal aid in response to decades of discrimination by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. President Joe Biden announced the payments Wednesday. The USDA says more than 23,000 farmer…
articleContent: COLUMBIA, Mo. (AP) The Biden administration has doled out more than $2 billion in direct payments for Black and other minority farmers discriminated against by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, the… [+3078 chars]
fqTitle: Will more than $2 billion in federal aid be distributed to minority farmers by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, more than $2 billion in federal aid has been distributed to minority farmers. The aid must be documented as distributed by the U.S. Department of Agriculture or other relevant authorities.

articleTitle: Black and other minority farmers are getting $2 billion from USDA after years of discrimination

fqTitle: Will the U.S. Department of Agriculture announce additional aid for minority farmers by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Agriculture officially announces any additional federal aid for minority farmers beyond the $2 billion already allocated.
